node.title: Adele’s ‘30’ Crosses a Million Sales and Holds at No. 1
node.alt: Adele held the No. 1 spot on the Billboard album chart for a third week with “30.”
node.description: The singer’s first album in six years became the first release to reach that milestone since Taylor Swift’s “Evermore” a year ago. But in 2015, Adele’s “25” sold 3.4 million its first week.
node.content: ["Adele holds the No. 1 spot on the Billboard album chart for a third time this week with \u201c30,\u201d with no major new releases to challenge it.", "Her first album in six years, \u201c30\u201d had the equivalent of 193,000 sales in the United States, according to MRC Data, Billboard\u2019s tracking arm. That included 58 million streams and 149,000 copies sold as a complete package. \u201c30\u201d has now sold more than one million copies as a full album, the first release to do so since Taylor Swift\u2019s \u201cEvermore\u201d a little over a year ago \u2014 though Adele\u2019s last LP, \u201c25,\u201d sold nearly 3.4 million in its first week out in 2015, when Adele withheld the complete album from streaming services.", "Also this week, Swift\u2019s \u201cRed (Taylor\u2019s Version)\u201d holds at No. 2. Polo G\u2019s \u201cHall of Fame,\u201d which opened at No. 1 back in June, jumped 66 spots to No. 3 thanks to a new version with extra tracks. Michael Bubl\u00e9\u2019s \u201cChristmas,\u201d a seasonal hit each year since its release a decade ago, is No. 4, and Olivia Rodrigo\u2019s \u201cSour\u201d is No. 5.", "Morgan Wallen\u2019s \u201cDangerous: The Double Album,\u201d which had a 10-week run at No. 1 at the start of the year and has never dipped further than No. 9 on the chart, holds in sixth place."]
